verses.roman:
śrutvājitaṁ jarāsandhaṁ
nṛpater dhyāyato hariḥ
āhopāyaṁ tam evādya
uddhavo yam uvāca ha

synonyms: śrutvā—hearing; ajitam—unconquered; jarāsandham—Jarāsandha; nṛpateḥ—the King; dhyāyataḥ—as he pondered; hariḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; āha—told; upāyam—the means; tam—to him; eva—indeed; ādyaḥ—the original person; uddhavaḥ—Uddhava; yam—which; uvāca ha—had spoken.
translation: When King Yudhiṣṭhira heard that Jarāsandha remained undefeated, he set to pondering, and then the primeval Lord, Hari, told him the means Uddhava had described for defeating Jarāsandha.
